page.title: 10Horse Riding-Laughton Area 2
page.content: 4. More girls than boys enjoy riding. They also enjoy looking after the animals. 5. There are lots of problems in our area for both riders and owners of riding stables. (a) motor traffic is often inconsiderate. (b) bridle paths do not always interlink. (c) farmers generally find horse riders a nuisance. (d) riding establishments are not classed as agricultural by the Government, which means they do not get the same financial help as farmers. (e) there is a shortage of hay because farmers are growing more profitable crops. This pushes up the price of horse feed.
